item.title: [317 Delta] Working D Shield halves (Simple Code)
item.dc:creator: @excel4 excel4
item.description:
@excel4 wrote:

Hey all! Today, I am going to show you how to make working Dragon Sq Shield parts to combine into a Dragon Sq Shield! This was tested and it works 100% (If you didn’t you messed up bad.)

Difficulty - 1/10
Server Tested on - Delta
File Edited - Client.java (Server Sided)

You can take all the credit.

1. Open up Client.java.

2. Use Ctrl+F and search for } else if ((itemUsed == 1513) && (useWith == 590))

3. When that whole code method finishes after the last bracket, paste this underneath the last bracket of that code. if(itemUsed == 2366 && useWith == 2368){ deleteItem(2366, getItemSlot(2366), 1); deleteItem(2368, getItemSlot(2368), 1); addItem(1187, 1); sM("You make a Dragon Square Shield!"); } else { sM("You need both parts of the shield to make it."); }
^^ Explaining the code: When you use the item 2366 with 2368, it deletes both of those item and adds the item 1187. When it is complete, it sends the message “You make a Dragon Sq Shield!” But if you use one half with a different item, it says “You need both parts of the shield to make it.” It’s simple!

4. You’re almost done! Now lets say you use item 2366 and 2368 in a different order (e.g. 2368 + 2366) it will say, “You need both parts of the shield to make it.” And you won’t get the shield. Then just paste the same code again right underneath and switch the first 2366 and 2368 so it looks like this. if(itemUsed == 2368 && useWith == 2366){ deleteItem(2366, getItemSlot(2366), 1); deleteItem(2368, getItemSlot(2368), 1); addItem(1187, 1); sM("You make a Dragon Square Shield!"); } else { sM("You need both parts of the shield to make it."); }
It looks very similar but it is very important!

5. Now just save, compile, and run! You are done! Now you have a fully working Dragon Sq. Shield halves combination! (W/e you want to call it)

I hope this helped!

Read full topic
